facts.title: DevFest Siberia
facts.topicsDescription: Mobile Development, Modern Web Application Development, Data Science, DevOps, Security and more
facts.workshopsDescription: Full separated day of workshops, hands-on experience, hacking and debugging. Come and tame your favourite technology!

items.title: Android Dev Podcast
items.text: Android Dev - is a podcast about apps development for Android and anything around. Our guests - experienced developers, who knows Android since version 1.5

speakers.description: Head of DevRel and Developer Advocate at JFrog
speakers.text:
Baruch‚Äôs passion is speaking about technology. Well, speaking in general, but doing it about technology makes him look smart, and 17 years of hi-tech experience sure helps. When he‚Äôs not on stage (or on a plane to get there), he learns about technology, people and how they work, or more precisely, don‚Äôt work together.
Baruch is a Head of DevRel and a Developer Advocate at JFrog, a CNCF Ambassador, a passionate conference speaker on DevOps, Java and Groovy topics, and is a regular at the industry‚Äôs most prestigious events including JavaOne (where he was awarded a Rock Star award), DockerCon, Devoxx, DevOps Days, OSCON, Qcon and many others. Follow him on Twitter (as he's a very entertaining guy!) at @jbaruch.

Valarie Regas is a youngling developer, a Georgia Tech coding bootcamp graduate, and a veteran mommy. She holds a BA in Psychology and currently works as a Jr. DevOps Engineer. After years being a stay-at-home mom, she decided to change her life by entering Tech, and has learned a lot along the way. She enjoys mixed martial arts fighting, table-top role playing games, public speaking, creating tiny humans, and political activism.

Google Developer Expert Angular & Web Technologies, Google certified Sprint Master, international speaker in conferences such as JSConf, QCon, Devfest and others conferences around the world. Passionate open source contributor and active in the communities around Webpack, Angular, React, JavaScript, HTML5, CSS3, Web Workflow, Web Performance, security and Internet of things - topic which he published the book ‚ÄúNodebots - Javascript and robotics in the real world‚Äù.

Ignat is a platform engineer at Cloudflare, where he works mostly with bare-metal Linux. Ignat‚Äôs interests are cryptography, hacking, and low-level programming. Previously, he was a senior security engineer at Samsung Electronics‚Äôs Mobile Communications Division, and his solutions can be found in many older Samsung smartphones and tablets. Ignat started his career as a security researcher in the Ukrainian government‚Äôs communications services.

Sebastian Daschner is a Java Developer Advocate at IBM, a consultant, author, and trainer. He is participating in the JCP, helping forming the future standards of Java EE, serving in the JSR 370 and 374 Expert Groups and collaborating on various open source projects. For his contributions in the Java community and ecosystem he was recognized as a Java Champion, Oracle Developer Champion and double 2016 JavaOne Rockstar. He has been working with enterprise Java for more than 8 years. Besides Java, Sebastian is also a heavy user of Linux and container technologies like Docker. He evangelizes computer science practices on his blog, his Newsletter, and on Twitter via @DaschnerS. When not working with Java, he also loves to travel the world‚Äâ‚Äî‚Äâeither by plane or motorbike.

Progressive Web Apps Developer. CTO at GdeZerno (‚ÄúUber‚Äù for grain trucks) start-up. Google Developers Group Krasnodar organizer. PWA, Web Components, GraphQL, Firebase evangelist. PWA Russian-speaking community organizer. Cutting edge technology enthusiast.

Enthusiast of web technologies especially Single Page Apps, Progressive Web Apps, microservices, and Internet of Things. Author of articles about JavaScript, NodeJS, and Angular. Open Source contributor - creator of @ng-toolkit opensource project - set of tools for expanding existing Angular applications.

Supratim, is a Human-computer interaction researcher at Simon Fraser University, Vancouver. He specializes in developing interactive mobile visualization tools. He has previously worked as an Android developer for NewtonMail, a popular multi-platform email client. He is currently working on a data visualization software called VizInteract, which uses Android Canvas APIs and Multi-Touch interaction framework to provide gesture driven data analysis experiences. He also engages with android developer communities as the organizer for Google Developer Group Surrey. When not talking up Star Wars to Star Trek fans, he likes to build android apps as side projects that solve some utilitarian problem in his daily life. One of his side projects OnTime - Smart Widget got featured on Product Hunt as well

Adri√°n is an experienced Frontend developer and Web Team Lead, focusing now in Web Accessibility (a11y), and since 2012 he is living and working in Vienna.
When Adri√°n is not at the office he enjoys a good read, working the way through any delicious recipe, and indulging my love for travelling to new places.

Majid Hajian is a software developer has developed and architected complex web applications since 2007 after he graduated as a software engineer.
A software developer at heart, Majid is passionate about web platform especially hardware connectivity and performance and in particular Progressive Web Apps.
He loves sharing his knowledge with the community by writing on his blog majidhajian.com and tweeting @mhadaily, speaking at conferences, visiting developers to help them, contributing to open source and organizing meetups and events.
Majid is the author of "Progressive web app with Angular" book published by Apress and "Progressive Web Apps" video tutorial published by PacktPub and Udemy. 
He is (co)organizer of a few meetups in Norway dedicated to frontend and mobile in Oslo including Mobile meetup and Vue.js Oslo and Angular Oslo, Framisa and an Organizer of Mobile Era and ngVikings which are the main Nordic conferences for mobile and Angular.
Andrew wrote his hello-world for Android in 2012. He worked at big companies such as Yandex, Tinkoff, Revolut and Bolt, so his code is running on tens of millions of devices.

Cloud software engineer at Hazelcast, author of the book "Continuous Delivery with Docker and Jenkins", trainer, and conference speaker. He specializes in Java development, Cloud environments, and Continuous Delivery. Former employee in a number of companies and scientific organizations: Google, CERN, AGH University, and more.

Mikolaj is a designer and front-end developer leading a design team at ucreate, a British company specialised in building startups. He's passionate about UI Design and typography, and works a lot with CSS and SVG.

coc.title: Code Of Conduct
coc.rules: All attendees, speakers, sponsors and volunteers at DevFest Siberia are required to agree with the following code of conduct. Organisers will enforce this code throughout the event. We are expecting cooperation from all participants to help ensuring a safe environment for everybody.
coc.about: DevFest Siberia is dedicated to providing a harassment-free conference experience for everyone, regardless of gender, sexual orientation, disability, physical appearance, body size, race, or religion. We do not tolerate harassment of conference participants in any form. Sexual language and imagery is not appropriate for any conference venue, including talks, workshops, parties, Twitter and other online communication channels. Conference participants violating these rules may be sanctioned or expelled from the conference without a refund at the discretion of the conference organisers.

meta.description: DevFest Siberia - a people-first conference for developers and IT enthusiasts. Main topics: Mobile Development, IoT, Google Cloud, Google APIs, Virtual and Augmented Reality, Modern Web Application Development, Firebase Interaction from experts around the world. Awesome speakers and lots of fun!
meta.twitter-description: DevFest Siberia - a people-first conference for developers and IT enthusiasts. Main topics: Mobile Development, Modern Web Application Development, Machine Learning and Blockchain development from experts around the world. Awesome speakers and lots of fun!
